title: Chris Krebs
deleted: On November 12, 2020, Krebs was fired by the loser of the 2020 Election, Donald J. Trump.

title: Chris Krebs
added: On November 12, 2020 it was reported that Krebs expected to be fired during the post-election purge being conduced by the Trump administration among people suspected of being disloyal to the president.<ref>Eric Geller and Natasha Bertrand, ''[https://www.politico.com/news/2020/11/12/cyber-official-chris-krebs-likely-out-436342?nname=politico-nightly&nid=00000170-c000-da87-af78-e185fa700000&nrid=0000015f-9714-d3a6-addf-971dd1d60001&nlid=2670445 Top cyber official expecting to be fired as White House frustrations hit agency protecting elections]'', Politico, November 12, 2020 </ref>

title: Chris Krebs
added: On November 17, 2020, Donald Trump claimed to fire Krebs via Tweet. <ref>{{Cit web|website=[[Twitter]]|url=https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1328852354049957888}}</ref>

title: Chris Krebs
added: Later that month, a lawyer for the Trump campaign, [[Joseph diGenova]], called for Krebs to be "[[drawn and quartered]]. Taken out at dawn and shot". diGenova's specific criticism was that Krebs "thinks the election went well".<ref>{{Cite web|last1=Wong|first1=Julia|title=Arizona and Wisconsin certify Joe Biden's win as Trump continues to challenge results â€“ as it happened|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2020/nov/30/us-election-joe-biden-donald-trump-coronavirus-covid-19-live-updates|archiveurl=https://archive.is/BBxbT|archivedate=December 1, 2020|access-date=December 1, 2020|website=[[The Guardian]]|language=en}}</ref>
